title: Chomsky on language, Manufacturing Consent and postmodernism.
description:
Is language really not primarily for communication? 
Was President Trump more enslaved to corporations than any preceding President?
Are fake news and alternative facts the results of postmodernism?

Professor Noam Chomsky speaks to Vittorio  Pelosi of the Intentist art movement about language theory and intention, Manufacturing Consent theory, postmodernism and alternative facts, and American domestic policy (including gun laws.)

00:00 Background to the conversation
00:31 Introduction and welcome to Professor Chomsky
01:05 Question One- Is language primarily for communication or thought? Has this become dogma?
10:18 Question Two- Was Trump's presidency the best example of Manufacturing Consent Theory?
15:24 Question Three - Has postmodernism led to the concepts of 'fake news' and 'alternative facts'?
22:27 The increase in the number of 'deaths of despair' in the US.
23:25 Identity politics
23:42 Chomsky, 'The US society is literally collapsing.'
23:50 The US and guns laws
26:48 Closing statements

Intentism is the international art movement that includes artists, writers, musicians, actors, philosophers. We maintain that, "All meaning is the imperfect outworking of intention."
